Notes: Engineering hours for permit identification, application preparation, supporting documentation, internal review, Employer review, authority submission. Assumes 600 hrs @ $125/hr for 5-8 major permit applications (VFPA PER, DFO, TC, building, construction, environmental, fire). Range: $50k-$100k.

External consultant support for permit applications and compliance monitoring. Typical scope: environmental assessments, permit prep support, regulatory liaison, compliance monitoring. Assumes 300 hrs @ $200/hr. Covers ~50% of regulatory work. Range: $40k-$100k.

Permit fees for Contractor-responsible permits: building permit ($5k-$15k), construction permits ($2k-$5k), environmental permits ($1k-$5k), fire approval ($1k-$3k), other fees ($1k-$5k). Excludes Employer-responsible permits. Range: $10k-$50k.
PKG-32 is administrative/document-based with no physical construction or field installation work. All work is engineering, PM, and QA/QC.

QA/QC hours for VFPA PER compliance monitoring and documentation. Typical VFPA PER: 10-30 conditions. Assumes 200 hrs @ $125/hr. Covers condition tracking, monitoring reports, VFPA submittals, closeout. Range: $15k-$40k.

QA/QC hours for DFO Fisheries Act authorization compliance. Typical DFO authorization: 5-15 conditions (marine environmental protection focus). Assumes 160 hrs @ $125/hr. Covers marine work windows, environmental monitoring, DFO reporting. Range: $10k-$30k.

QA/QC hours for Transport Canada compliance (rail, marine interface). Typical TC approvals: 3-10 conditions. Assumes 120 hrs @ $125/hr. Covers rail/marine safety compliance, inspection coordination, reporting. Range: $8k-$25k.

QA/QC hours for code inspection coordination (building, structural, fire, electrical, mechanical). Typical: 15-30 inspections. Assumes 240 hrs @ $125/hr. Covers inspection scheduling, attendance, deficiency tracking, re-inspections, certificate of occupancy. Range: $20k-$45k.
Procurement services for consultant RFP/contracting and permit fee payment processing. Parametric allocation: P = 2% × MAT ($85k) = $1.7k. Typical range: 1%-3% of MAT.

PM hours for permit receipt, condition review, register update, distribution, compliance tracking initiation. Embedded in PM parametric allocation. Assumes 150 hrs total over project lifecycle. Component allocation: $5k.
PM hours for correspondence register template setup, entry logging, status updates, reporting, closeout. Embedded in PM parametric allocation. Assumes 60 hrs. Component allocation: $2k.
PM hours for correspondence filing, archive organization, closeout package assembly. Embedded in PM parametric allocation. Assumes 50 hrs. Component allocation: $1k.

EPCM/PM allocation for overall PKG-32 coordination and management. Parametric allocation: PM = 6% × (E + MAT + CD + CI base) = 6% × $250k = $15k total. Breakdown: $5k (A-3202) + $2k (A-3209) + $1k (A-3210) + $7k (this line) = $15k. Typical range: 4%-10%.

Commissioning/closeout allocation for regulatory compliance closeout, certificate of occupancy, final permit submissions. Parametric allocation: COM = 3% × (E + MAT + CD + CI base) = 3% × $250k = $7.5k, rounded to $7k. Typical range: 1%-5%.
